snippet: Yefim Zadov, a 79-year-old immigrant from Ukraine, likes his newly built apartment in Manhattan, but he misses his friends — fellow Russian speakers he left behind in Brooklyn.
abstract: Yefim Zadov, after five years on waiting list, is approved for apartment in Manhattan, in new affordable-housing complex for elderly owned by Metropolitan Council on Jewish Poverty, beneficiary agency of UJA-Federation of New York.
lead_paragraph: Yefim Zadov, a 79-year-old immigrant from Ukraine, likes his newly built apartment in Manhattan, but he misses his friends — fellow Russian speakers he left behind in Brooklyn.

headline.main: For an Immigrant, a New Home Brings Comfort but Also Isolation
headline.print_headline: For an Immigrant, a New Home Brings Comfort but Also Isolation

keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
keywords.name: organizations
